column4: Other than wine, are there any other good Windows emulators/compatibility layers out there?
wine is 'Wine Is Not an Emulator
That's why I said "compatibility layer" also :p
crossover i think
yea noticed that later :)
qemu is emulator though
which would you suggest to try first, crossover or qemu?
i dont have experience in either, but you should try both since one is an emu and one is a compatibility layer thing
can't find crossover in Ubuntu software center, where is it?
its not free
Aha.
maybe if you tell the channel what you are looking or trying to do,someone might suggest some good things
http://www.codeweavers.com/products/
Basically, I want to use the NES emulator from my old windows computer. the reason I don't want to use an ubuntu emulator is because I have a save rather far along I don't want to lose.
The emulator doesn't work great in wine, I was wondering if there was another I could try.
why
Not "sad" as in unhappy. Sad as in pathetic. Read my previous sentence. :p
ok :)
I mean, you've just been helping me with my question, have you already forgotten? ;)
no, but i cant advice on this further
Well, NES emulators and Windows emulators (YIKWINAE) are two different topics, and there was discussion drift. I had already expected it to move into the realm of other people's expertise.
